scheme_name: Scholarship for Engineering and Medical Education
sub_categories: Education and training grants, fellowship, stipend
brief_description: The scheme aims to support the higher education of dependents of ex-servicemen by providing financial assistance for pursuing engineering, medical, and PhD courses. Under this scheme, annual scholarships are awarded to beneficiaries based on their course of study.
detailed_description: The scheme &quot;Scholarship for Engineering and Medical Education&quot; was introduced by the Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to support the higher education of dependents of ex-servicemen by providing financial assistance for pursuing engineering, medical, and PhD courses. Under this scheme, annual scholarships are awarded to beneficiaries based on their course of study.
benefits: ₹12,000/- per year for Engineering students ₹15,000/- per year for Medical students ₹10,000/- per year for PhD students
Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the bank account annually.
The disbursement is done via Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) from the Kargil Shaheed Pariwar Mukhyamantri Sahayata Kosh.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant should be a dependent of an ex-serviceman. The applicant should be pursuing a course in Engineering, Medical, or Ph.D. from a recognized institution. The applicant's name should be correctly recorded in the ex-serviceman's discharge book. Note: It is mandatory that the applicant's correct name is mentioned both in the bank account and the discharge book.

steps: Visit the official website: www.sainikkalyan.org  Click on the relevant scholarship application link. Fill in the form with accurate personal and academic information. Upload scanned copies of all mandatory documents. Submit the application online.
Applications are verified at the District Sainik Kalyan Office and Directorate level. Upon approval, the amount is credited directly to the applicant's bank account.

Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the District Soldier Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Soldier Welfare Office.

documents_required: Aadhaar Card of the Applicant Bank Account Details Ex-serviceman Identity Card Discharge Book of the ex-serviceman Current Course Enrollment Certificate
